verses.verse: When thou sittest<WH3427> to eat<WH3898> with a ruler<WH4910>, consider<WH995> diligently<WH995> what is before<WH6440> thee:
And put<WH7760> a knife<WH7915> to thy throat<WH3930>, if thou be a man given<WH1167> to appetite<WH5315>.
Be not desirous<WH183> of his dainties<WH4303>: for they are deceitful<WH3577> meat<WH3899>.
Labour<WH3021> not to be rich<WH6238>: cease<WH2308> from thine own wisdom<WH998>.

Wilt thou set<WH5774> <WH5774> thine eyes<WH5869> upon that which is not? for riches certainly<WH6213> make<WH6213> themselves wings<WH3671>; they fly away<WH5774> <WH5774> as an eagle<WH5404> toward heaven<WH8064>. set: Heb. cause thine eyes to fly upon
Eat<WH3898> thou not the bread<WH3899> of him that hath an evil<WH7451> eye<WH5869>, neither desire<WH183> thou his dainty meats<WH4303>:
For as he thinketh<WH8176> in his heart<WH5315>, so is he: Eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, saith<WH559> he to thee; but his heart<WH3820> is not with thee.
The morsel<WH6595> which thou hast eaten<WH398> shalt thou vomit up<WH6958>, and lose<WH7843> thy sweet<WH5273> words<WH1697>.
Speak<WH1696> not in the ears<WH241> of a fool<WH3684>: for he will despise<WH936> the wisdom<WH7922> of thy words<WH4405>.
Remove<WH5253> not the old<WH5769> landmark<WH1366>; and enter<WH935> not into the fields<WH7704> of the fatherless<WH3490>: landmark: or, bound
For their redeemer<WH1350> is mighty<WH2389>; he shall plead<WH7378> their cause<WH7379> with thee.
Apply<WH935> thine heart<WH3820> unto instruction<WH4148>, and thine ears<WH241> to the words<WH561> of knowledge<WH1847>.
Withhold<WH4513> not correction<WH4148> from the child<WH5288>: for if thou beatest<WH5221> him with the rod<WH7626>, he shall not die<WH4191>.
Thou shalt beat<WH5221> him with the rod<WH7626>, and shalt deliver<WH5337> his soul<WH5315> from hell<WH7585>.
My son<WH1121>, if thine heart<WH3820> be wise<WH2449>, my heart<WH3820> shall rejoice<WH8055>, even mine<WH589>. even: or, even I will rejoice
Yea, my reins<WH3629> shall rejoice<WH5937>, when thy lips<WH8193> speak<WH1696> right things<WH4339>.
Let not thine heart<WH3820> envy<WH7065> sinners<WH2400>: but be thou in the fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068> all the day<WH3117> long.
For surely there is<WH3426> an end<WH319>; and thine expectation<WH8615> shall not be cut off<WH3772>. end: or, reward
Hear<WH8085> thou, my son<WH1121>, and be wise<WH2449>, and guide<WH833> thine heart<WH3820> in the way<WH1870>.
Be not among winebibbers<WH3196> <WH5433>; among riotous eaters<WH2151> of flesh<WH1320>: of flesh: Heb. of their flesh
For the drunkard<WH5433> and the glutton<WH2151> shall come to poverty<WH3423>: and drowsiness<WH5124> shall clothe<WH3847> a man with rags<WH7168>.
Hearken<WH8085> unto thy father<WH1> that begat<WH3205> thee, and despise<WH936> not thy mother<WH517> when she is old<WH2204>.
Buy<WH7069> the truth<WH571>, and sell<WH4376> it not; also wisdom<WH2451>, and instruction<WH4148>, and understanding<WH998>.
The father<WH1> of the righteous<WH6662> shall greatly<WH1524> rejoice<WH1523>: and he that begetteth<WH3205> a wise<WH2450> child shall have joy<WH8055> of him.
Thy father<WH1> and thy mother<WH517> shall be glad<WH8055>, and she that bare<WH3205> thee shall rejoice<WH1523>.
My son<WH1121>, give<WH5414> me thine heart<WH3820>, and let thine eyes<WH5869> observe<WH7521> <WH5341> my ways<WH1870>.
For a whore<WH2181> is a deep<WH6013> ditch<WH7745>; and a strange woman<WH5237> is a narrow<WH6862> pit<WH875>.
She also lieth in wait<WH693> as for a prey<WH2863>, and increaseth<WH3254> the transgressors<WH898> among men<WH120>. as for: or, as a robber
Who hath woe<WH188>? who hath sorrow<WH17>? who hath contentions<WH4079> <WH4066>? who hath babbling<WH7879>? who hath wounds<WH6482> without cause<WH2600>? who hath redness<WH2448> of eyes<WH5869>?
They that tarry long<WH309> at the wine<WH3196>; they that go<WH935> to seek<WH2713> mixed wine<WH4469>.
Look<WH7200> not thou upon the wine<WH3196> when it is red<WH119>, when it giveth<WH5414> his colour<WH5869> in the cup<WH3563> <WH3599>, when it moveth<WH1980> itself aright<WH4339>.
At the last<WH319> it biteth<WH5391> like a serpent<WH5175>, and stingeth<WH6567> like an adder<WH6848>. an: or, a cockatrice
Thine eyes<WH5869> shall behold<WH7200> strange women<WH2114>, and thine heart<WH3820> shall utter<WH1696> perverse things<WH8419>.
Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down<WH7901> in the midst<WH3820> of the sea<WH3220>, or as he that lieth<WH7901> upon the top<WH7218> of a mast<WH2260>. the midst: Heb. the heart of the sea

They have stricken<WH5221> me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick<WH2470>; they have beaten<WH1986> me, and I felt<WH3045> it not: when shall I awake<WH6974>? I will seek<WH1245> it yet<WH3254> again. I felt: Heb. I knew it not
